Package connectfour

Class Model

java.lang.Object
connectfour.Model
public class Model extends Object
The Model class represents the game logic and data in the Connect Four game. It manages the game board, player turns, moves, and win conditions.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Model()
    Constructs a new Model object and initializes the game board.

  • Constructor Details

    • Model

      public Model()
      Constructs a new Model object and initializes the game board.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      public int makeMove(int column)
      Attempts to make a move in the specified column for the current player. Finds the bottom empty cell in the column and updates the board.
      Parameters:
      column - The column in which to make the move.
      Returns:
      The row where the move was made, or -1 if the column is full.

    • getBoardValue

      public int getBoardValue(int col, int row)
      Gets the value of the cell at the specified column and row on the board.
      Parameters:
      col - The column index.
      row - The row index.
      Returns:
      The value of the cell at the specified column and row.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game by initializing the board and setting the current player to 1.

    • checkWinner

      public int checkWinner()
      Checks for a winner by scanning the board for four consecutive chips in a row, column, or diagonal.
      Returns:
      0 if no winner yet, 1 or 2 if a player wins, -1 for a draw.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      protected int getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player making the move.
      Returns:
      The current player (1 or 2).
